text: Big Machine Records is an American record label. It specializes in country music. Big Machine is based on Music Row in Nashville, Tennessee. It is distributed by Universal Music Group (UMG). ==History== The label was created in 2005 by former DreamWorks Records executive, Scott Borchetta. It initially became a joint venture between Borchetta and country singer Toby Keith. ==Business== As of November 2014, the company has 88 employees in the areas of music publishing, management, merchandising and four office buildings. The business also oversees numerous imprints, like Valory Music, that are under Big Machine Label Group. ==Artists== Artists signed to the label include Taylor Swift, Tim McGraw, Reba McEntire and Rascal Flatts. ==References== Category:American record labels Category:2005 establishments in the United States Category:Big Machine Records
title: Big Machine Records
